ticket.title: Auditor/orchestrator projections for launch lineage, liveness, and uncertainty

tickets.reason: Boundary enforcement semantics are prerequisite for trustworthy projection reporting.
Projection surfaces depend on liveness and terminal taxonomy contracts.

in_scope: Expose auditor projection showing launch lineage completeness and boundary-conformance indicators.
Expose orchestrator projection showing active runs, last authoritative receipt tick, restart count, and uncertainty flags.
Make projection responses digest-first and replay-consistent for independent verification.
Fail closed when required lineage/liveness evidence is missing or unresolved.
out_of_scope: Core launch admission and Markov-blanket enforcement logic changes.

steps: Define projection contracts and required fields for auditor/orchestrator consumers.
Implement projection endpoints/commands over receipt-backed state.
Integrate uncertainty classification for missing lineage/liveness evidence.
Add tests ensuring projection determinism and fail-closed uncertainty behavior.

criteria: Auditor projection reports lineage completeness and boundary-conformance from receipt-backed data.
Orchestrator projection reports liveness/uncertainty state for dispatch control decisions.
Missing lineage/liveness evidence is surfaced as non-admissible uncertainty.

notes.security: Projection ambiguity must not be silently accepted for authority-bearing operations.
notes.verification: Include deterministic replay checks on projection outputs across repeated queries.
notes.general: This ticket closes operator-facing visibility gaps for launch-path governance and control.
